wikipedia_page.main: Frederick Peter Kippax (17 July 1922 – 21 September 1987) was an English amateur footballer who played as a left winger.

response: He ran his own bat making business for almost thirty years, Peter Kippax Sports and then Kippax Willow, with his English willow bats being used by many Yorkshire county and league players. Kippax died from Alzheimer's disease in January 2017 aged 76.
